definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: There was a rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and who feasted sumptuously every day.
sentences.chinese: 有一個財主穿著紫色袍和細麻布衣服，天天奢華宴樂。

sentences.english: Then said Jesus unto his disciples, Verily I say unto you, That a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌對門徒說，我實在告訴你們，財主進天國是難的。

sentences.english: Zhen, a local rich man who also needed warehouses, inspected the property.
sentences.chinese: 一位姓甄的財主正需要倉庫，他來看了這些房子。

sentences.english: An upstart like that dares to bandy words with me!
sentences.chinese: 這樣一個小財主也敢跟我逗嘴皮子。

sentences.english: And, behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.
sentences.chinese: 有一個人名叫撒該，作稅吏長，是個財主。

sentences.english: 2A man was there by the name of Zacchaeus; he was a chief tax collector and was wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 有一個人名叫撒該，作稅吏長，是個財主。

sentences.english: 1As he looked up, Jesus saw the rich putting their gifts into the temple treasury.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌擡頭觀看，見財主把捐項投在庫裏。

sentences.english: His grandpa used to be very rich, so there are many antiques in his house.
sentences.chinese: 他爺爺原來是財主，家裏有很多骨董。

sentences.english: Her father is rich as Croesus. He owns several houses and factories in other countries.
sentences.chinese: 他父親是個大財主，在國外還有幾幢房子和幾家工廠。

sentences.english: Then you must come with me and recover my stolen money.
sentences.chinese: 財主邀請他同去把被偷盜的錢財找回來。

sentences.english: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
sentences.chinese: 駱駝穿過針的眼，比財主進神的國，還容易呢。

sentences.english: Afanty borrowed a small ingot of gold from a moneybags, but repaid him two ones.
sentences.chinese: 阿凡提借了財主一錠金子，還他時給了他兩錠。

sentences.english: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
sentences.chinese: 駱駝穿過針的眼，比財主進神的國，還容易呢。

sentences.english: The rich men in the village call every poor person a fool.
sentences.chinese: 鄉里的土財主們把窮人統稱爲愚氓。

sentences.english: Wang Huonan was a rich man in Huainan.
sentences.chinese: 王獲楠是淮南的一個財主。

sentences.english: There they sold him to work for a rich man.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏，他們將約瑟賣給一個財主，要約瑟爲他工作。

definition: brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
